item.title: Report E-2024050210
item.description:
Report E-2024050210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party hauler was hooking onto a Veolia's outbound trailer. When the trailer made contact with the king pin, a yellow liquid began to drop slowly out of the trailer, just behind the tractor. The driver was instructed to pull away from the van. A Veolia employee then went to grab a bag of solid absorb and placed it below the leak. Approximately 4oz of the liquid was spilled onto the cement floor before it stopped. The trailer was then unloaded. During this time, the employees noticed that 3 drums were leaking from their bottom and sides. The bottom of the drums were corroded which caused pinholes on the bottom portion of the body of the drums. Employees then overpacked the 3 drums into poly containers. Approximately 4 oz of the liquid was released onto the trailer's floor. These 3 drums were profiled as a solid by the vendor. Possible misclassification of the waste along with improper packaging may have caused the leak. All three drums were placed into a poly 85 salvage drum. The manifest was then rejected back to the broker, and the broker came back to pick up their drums.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment external packaging was wet on underside and also dented on two corners. Leak source came from three out of the four gallon size plastic bottles of Cidehol70, 70% Isopropyl alcohol whose caps were not completely sealed. All four bottles were in a tied off plastic bag. No inner cushioning evident.

item.title: Report E-2024050119
item.description:
Report E-2024050119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL that was strapped down too tightly crushing the body and causing the lid to pop open. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release that impacted the plastic shrink wrap in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking PAIL, containerized the impacted shrink wrap, and cleaned-up the release with absorbent rags. In total, two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
